35 // It include three class Object_Handling, MoveitController(for task1), PclProcessor(for task2 and task3)
36 #include <object_handling_class.h>
38 Object_Handling::Object_Handling(ros::NodeHandle nh) : nh_(nh),
39  pcl_obj_(nh)
40 {
41  /* class constructor */
42  // advertise solutions for project tasks
43  t1_service_ = nh_.advertiseService("/task1_start",
44  &Object_Handling::t1_callback, this);
45  t2_service_ = nh_.advertiseService("/task2_start",
46  &Object_Handling::t2_callback, this);
47  t3_service_ = nh_.advertiseService("/task3_start",
48  &Object_Handling::t3_callback, this);
49 
50  ROS_INFO("Object_Handling class initialised");
51 }
52 
54 
55 bool
56 Object_Handling::t1_callback(panda_world_spawner::Task1Service::Request &request,
57  panda_world_spawner::Task1Service::Response &response)
58 {
59  /* function which should solve task 1 */
60  bool success = true;
61  ROS_INFO("The project solving callback for task 1 has been triggered");
62 
63  moveit_obj_.pickAndPlace(request.object_loc.pose.position, request.goal_loc.point);
64 
65  return true;
66 }
67 
69 
70 bool
71 Object_Handling::t2_callback(panda_world_spawner::Task2Service::Request &request,
72  panda_world_spawner::Task2Service::Response &response)
73 {
74  /* function which should solve task 2 */
75  bool success = true;
76  ROS_INFO("The project solving callback for task 2 has been triggered");
77 
78  // Move the arm to the scanning position
79  success *= moveit_obj_.moveArm(moveit_obj_.Scanning_pose);
80 
81  // Obtain the number of locations requested
82  int num_baskets = request.basket_locs.size();
83 
84  // Store the basket locations requested
85  for (int i = 0; i < num_baskets; i++)
86  {
87  geometry_msgs::Point &basket_loc = request.basket_locs[i].point;
88  pcl_obj_.locs_requested[i] = basket_loc;
89  }
90 
91  // Segment cluster of item and compute the position of the point cloud
92  pcl_obj_.clusterPC();
93 
94  // Obtain the size, location, and colour of each PC cluster
95  for (int i = 0; i < pcl_obj_.item_clusters.size(); ++i)
96  pcl_obj_.getPCProperty(i, pcl_obj_.item_clusters[i]);
97 
98  // The logic of this part is that every basket is chosen and compute the distance between each item is found.
99  // Then, using a map to store the index of basket and the corresponding colour from map, item_property_colour.
100 
101  // Match PC clusters with requested locations
102  // Initialise all response as "none"
103  response.basket_colours = std::vector<std::string>(pcl_obj_.locs_requested.size(), "none");
104  // Iterate throught requested locations
105  for (int i = 0; i < pcl_obj_.locs_requested.size(); ++i)
106  {
107  // Iterate through PC clusters
108  for (const auto &prop : pcl_obj_.pcProperties)
109  {
110  // Compare distance
111  double distance = std::sqrt(std::pow(pcl_obj_.locs_requested[i].x - prop.second.position.x, 2) +
112  std::pow(pcl_obj_.locs_requested[i].y - prop.second.position.y, 2));
113  if (distance < 0.1)
114  response.basket_colours[i] = prop.second.colour;
115  }
116  }
117 
118  ROS_INFO("%s, %s, %s, %s", response.basket_colours[0].c_str(), response.basket_colours[1].c_str(), response.basket_colours[2].c_str(), response.basket_colours[3].c_str());
119 
120  return true;
121 }
122 
124 
125 bool
126 Object_Handling::t3_callback(panda_world_spawner::Task3Service::Request &request,
127  panda_world_spawner::Task3Service::Response &response)
128 {
129  // Clear the maps for task repeatability
130  pcl_obj_.pcProperties.clear();
131  pcl_obj_.baskets.clear();
132  pcl_obj_.cubes.clear();
133 
134  bool success = true;
135  ROS_INFO("The project solving callback for task 3 has been triggered");
136 
137  // Move the arm to the scanning position
138  success *= moveit_obj_.moveArm(moveit_obj_.Scanning_pose);
139 
140  // Segment cluster of item and compute the position of the point cloud
141  pcl_obj_.clusterPC();
142 
143  // Obtain the size, type, location, and colour of each PC cluster
144  for (int i = 0; i < pcl_obj_.item_clusters.size(); ++i)
145  pcl_obj_.getPCProperty(i, pcl_obj_.item_clusters[i]);
146 
147  // Differentiate clusters into cubes and baskets
148  pcl_obj_.differentiateCluster(pcl_obj_.pcProperties);
149 
150  // Performe the pick and place
151  if (pcl_obj_.cubes.size() == 0)
152  ROS_INFO("No cube to pick!");
153  // Iterate throught cubes
154  for (const auto &cube : pcl_obj_.cubes)
155  {
156  int basket_idx = 0;
157  // Iterate throught baskets
158  for (const auto &basket : pcl_obj_.baskets)
159  {
160  // If the colour matches
161  if (cube.second.colour == basket.second.colour)
162  {
163  // Perform the pick and place operation
164  moveit_obj_.pickAndPlace(cube.second.position, basket.second.position);
165  break; // Move to the next cube once placed
166  }
167  else
168  basket_idx++;
169  // No matched basket for the current cube
170  if (basket_idx == pcl_obj_.baskets.size())
171  {
172  ROS_INFO("No matched basket found for %s cube", cube.second.colour.c_str());
173  }
174  }
175  }
176  return true;
177 }
178 
180 
181 MoveitController::MoveitController()
182 {
183  // Define grasping as from above
184  tf2::Quaternion q_x180deg(-1, 0, 0, 0);
185 
186  // Determine the grasping orientation
187  tf2::Quaternion q_object;
188  q_object.setRPY(0, 0, angle_offset_);
189  tf2::Quaternion q_result = q_x180deg * q_object;
190  grasp_orientation = tf2::toMsg(q_result);
191 
192  // Set the desired scanning pose
193  Scanning_pose.position.x = 0.4;
194  Scanning_pose.position.y = 0;
195  Scanning_pose.position.z = 0.85;
196  Scanning_pose.orientation = grasp_orientation;
197 }
199 
200 bool MoveitController::moveArm(geometry_msgs::Pose target_pose)
201 {
202  // Setup the target pose
203  ROS_INFO("Setting pose target");
204  arm_group_.setPoseTarget(target_pose);
205 
206  // Create a movement plan for the arm
207  ROS_INFO("Attempting to plan the path");
208  moveit::planning_interface::MoveGroupInterface::Plan my_plan;
209  bool success = (arm_group_.plan(my_plan) ==
210  moveit::planning_interface::MoveItErrorCode::SUCCESS);
211 
212  ROS_INFO("Visualising plan %s", success ? "" : "FAILED");
213 
214  // Execute the planned path
215  arm_group_.move();
216 
217  return success;
218 }
219 
221 
222 bool MoveitController::moveGripper(float width)
223 {
224  // Safety checks in case width exceeds safe values
225  if (width > gripper_open_)
226  width = gripper_open_;
227  if (width < gripper_closed_)
228  width = gripper_closed_;
229 
230  // Calculate the joint targets as half each of the requested distance
231  double eachJoint = width / 2.0;
232 
233  // Create a vector to hold the joint target for each joint
234  std::vector<double> gripperJointTargets(2);
235  gripperJointTargets[0] = eachJoint;
236  gripperJointTargets[1] = eachJoint;
237 
238  // Apply the joint target
239  hand_group_.setJointValueTarget(gripperJointTargets);
240 
241  // Move the robot hand
242  ROS_INFO("Attempting to plan the path");
243  moveit::planning_interface::MoveGroupInterface::Plan my_plan;
244  bool success = (hand_group_.plan(my_plan) ==
245  moveit::planning_interface::MoveItErrorCode::SUCCESS);
246 
247  ROS_INFO("Visualising plan %s", success ? "" : "FAILED");
248 
249  // Move the gripper joints
250  hand_group_.move();
251 
252  return success;
253 }
255 
256 bool
257 MoveitController::pickAndPlace(geometry_msgs::Point object_loc, geometry_msgs::Point goal_loc)
258 {
259  /* This function picks up an object using a pose. And place it in a basket.
260  The first given point is where the centre of the gripper fingers will converge,
261  The second point is the center of the basket where the object to be placed */
262 
263  // Set the desired grasping pose
264  grasp_pose.position = object_loc;
265  grasp_pose.orientation = grasp_orientation;
266  grasp_pose.position.z += z_offset_;
267 
268  // Set the desired pre-grasping pose
269  approach_pose = grasp_pose;
270  approach_pose.position.z += approach_distance_ob_;
271 
272  // Set the desired lifting pose
273  lifting_pose = grasp_pose;
274  lifting_pose.position.z += lifting_distance_;
275 
276  // Set the desired pose to place the object
277  place_pose.position = goal_loc;
278  place_pose.orientation = grasp_orientation;
279  place_pose.position.z += approach_distance_gol_;
280 
281  /* Now perform the pick */
282 
283  bool success = true;
284 
285  ROS_INFO("Begining pick operation");
286 
287  // Move the arm above the object
288  success *= moveArm(approach_pose);
289 
290  if (not success)
291  {
292  ROS_ERROR("Moving arm to pick approach pose failed");
293  return false;
294  }
295 
296  // Open the gripper
297  success *= moveGripper(gripper_open_);
298 
299  if (not success)
300  {
301  ROS_ERROR("Opening gripper prior to pick failed");
302  return false;
303  }
304 
305  // Approach to grasping pose
306  success *= moveArm(grasp_pose);
307 
308  if (not success)
309  {
310  ROS_ERROR("Moving arm to grasping pose failed");
311  return false;
312  }
313 
314  // Grasp!
315  success *= moveGripper(gripper_closed_);
316 
317  if (not success)
318  {
319  ROS_ERROR("Closing gripper to grasp failed");
320  return false;
321  }
322 
323  // Lifting with object
324  success *= moveArm(lifting_pose);
325 
326  if (not success)
327  {
328  ROS_ERROR("Lifting arm after picking failed");
329  return false;
330  }
331 
332  // Moving the object to the basket location
333  success *= moveArm(place_pose);
334 
335  if (not success)
336  {
337  ROS_ERROR("Moving the object to the basket failed");
338  return false;
339  }
340 
341  // Place!
342  success *= moveGripper(gripper_open_);
343 
344  if (not success)
345  {
346  ROS_ERROR("Opening gripper to place failed");
347  return false;
348  }
349 
350  ROS_INFO("Pick and place operation successful");
351 
352  return true;
353 }
354 
356 
357 PclProcessor::PclProcessor(ros::NodeHandle &nh) : g_cloud_ptr(new PointC), // input point cloud
358  g_cloud_filtered(new PointC), // filtered point cloud
359  g_tree_ptr(new pcl::search::KdTree<PointT>()), // KdTree
360  debug_(false)
361 {
362  g_nh = nh;
363 
364  // Define the publishers
365  g_pub_cloud = g_nh.advertise<sensor_msgs::PointCloud2>("filtered_cloud", 1, true);
366  g_pub_pose = g_nh.advertise<geometry_msgs::PointStamped>("cluster_pt", 1, true);
367 
368  // Define public variables
369  g_vg_leaf_sz = 0.001; // VoxelGrid leaf size: Better in a config file
370  g_pt_thrs_min = 0.0; // PassThrough min thres: Better in a config file
371  g_pt_thrs_max = 0.74; // PassThrough max thres: Better in a config file
372  type_threshold = 2500; // Threshold of differentiate cluster type
373 }
374 
376 
377 void
378 PclProcessor::pclCallback(const sensor_msgs::PointCloud2ConstPtr &cloud_input_msg)
379 {
380  // Extract inout point cloud info
381  g_input_pc_frame_id_ = cloud_input_msg->header.frame_id;
382 
383  // Convert to PCL data type
384  pcl_conversions::toPCL(*cloud_input_msg, g_pcl_pc);
385  pcl::fromPCLPointCloud2(g_pcl_pc, *g_cloud_ptr);
386 
387  // Perform the filtering and show
388  applyVX(g_cloud_ptr, g_cloud_filtered);
389  applyPT(g_cloud_filtered, g_cloud_filtered); // Clip in 'z' direction to remove the plane
390  pubFilteredPCMsg(g_pub_cloud, *g_cloud_filtered);
391 }
393 
394 void
395 PclProcessor::applyVX(PointCPtr &in_cloud_ptr,
396  PointCPtr &out_cloud_ptr)
397 {
398  g_vx.setInputCloud(in_cloud_ptr);
399  g_vx.setLeafSize(g_vg_leaf_sz, g_vg_leaf_sz, g_vg_leaf_sz);
400  g_vx.filter(*out_cloud_ptr);
401 
402  return;
403 }
404 
406 
407 void
408 PclProcessor::applyPT(PointCPtr &in_cloud_ptr,
409  PointCPtr &out_cloud_ptr)
410 {
411  g_pt.setInputCloud(in_cloud_ptr);
412  g_pt.setFilterFieldName("z");
413  g_pt.setFilterLimits(g_pt_thrs_min, g_pt_thrs_max);
414  g_pt.filter(*out_cloud_ptr);
415 
416  return;
417 }
418 
420 
421 void
422 PclProcessor::clusterPC()
423 {
424  pcl::PointCloud<pcl::PointXYZRGBA>::Ptr cloud(new pcl::PointCloud<pcl::PointXYZRGBA>);
425  // Copy current point cloud for clustering
426  pcl::copyPointCloud(*g_cloud_filtered, *cloud);
427  // Creating the KdTree object for the search method of the extraction
428  g_tree_ptr->setInputCloud(cloud);
429  std::vector<pcl::PointIndices> cluster_indices;
430  pcl::EuclideanClusterExtraction<pcl::PointXYZRGBA> ec;
431  ec.setClusterTolerance(0.015); // Setting the suitable radius to find the cluster
432  ec.setMinClusterSize(100); // Setting the minimum number points for each cluster
433  ec.setMaxClusterSize(10000); // Setting the maximum number points for each cluster
434  ec.setSearchMethod(g_tree_ptr);
435  ec.setInputCloud(cloud);
436  ec.extract(cluster_indices);
437 
438  // Using the for-loop to extract the point from the original point cloud
439  item_clusters.clear();
440  for (const auto &cluster : cluster_indices)
441  {
442  PointCPtr cloud_cluster(new PointC);
443  // extract the point from the original point cloud to the temporary container
444  for (const auto &index : cluster.indices)
445  cloud_cluster->push_back((*cloud)[index]);
446  cloud_cluster->width = cloud_cluster->size();
447  cloud_cluster->height = 1;
448  cloud_cluster->is_dense = true;
449  cloud_cluster->header.frame_id = g_input_pc_frame_id_;
450 
451  // Store the point cloud extracted from the original point cloud to the vector
452  item_clusters.push_back(cloud_cluster);
453  }
454 }
456 
457 void
458 PclProcessor::getPCProperty(int index, PointCPtr &in_cloud_ptr)
459 {
460  // Get the type of the cluster based on its size
461  std::string type;
462  if (in_cloud_ptr->size() > type_threshold)
463  type = "basket";
464  else
465  type = "cube";
466 
467  // Get the colour of the cluster
468  std::string colourOfCloud = getPCColour(in_cloud_ptr);
469 
470  // Compute the centroid position
471  Eigen::Vector4f centroid_in;
472  pcl::compute3DCentroid(*in_cloud_ptr, centroid_in);
473  g_pt_msg.header.frame_id = g_input_pc_frame_id_;
474  g_pt_msg.header.stamp = ros::Time(0);
475  g_pt_msg.point.x = centroid_in[0];
476  g_pt_msg.point.y = centroid_in[1];
477  g_pt_msg.point.z = centroid_in[2];
478 
479  // Transform the point to new frame
480  geometry_msgs::PointStamped g_pt_msg_out;
481  try
482  {
483  g_listener_.transformPoint("panda_link0", // bad styling
484  g_pt_msg,
485  g_pt_msg_out);
486  }
487  catch (tf::TransformException &ex)
488  {
489  ROS_ERROR("Received a trasnformation exception: %s", ex.what());
490  }
491  // Publish the pointstamp
492  publishPose(g_pt_msg_out);
493 
494  // Store the preperties of the PC cluster in a map
495  pcProperties[index] = clusterProperties(in_cloud_ptr->size(), type, colourOfCloud, g_pt_msg_out.point);
496  return;
497 }
498

502 PclProcessor::pubFilteredPCMsg(ros::Publisher &pc_pub,
503  PointC &pc)

505  // Publish the data
506  pcl::toROSMsg(pc, g_cloud_filtered_msg);
507  pc_pub.publish(g_cloud_filtered_msg);
508 
509  return;
510 }

514 void
515 PclProcessor::publishPose(geometry_msgs::PointStamped &pt_msg)
516 {
517  // Create and publish the cylinder pose(ignore orientation)
518  g_pub_pose.publish(pt_msg);
519 
520  return;
521 }
522 
524 
525 // Identify the colour of a point cloud cluster
526 std::string PclProcessor::getPCColour(PointCPtr cloud)
527 {
528  // Initialize a map storing color counts
529  std::map<std::string, int> colour_counts = {
530  {"red", 0},
531  {"purple", 0},
532  {"blue", 0}};
533 
534  // Seed the random number generator to ensure different results each run
535  std::srand(static_cast<unsigned int>(std::time(nullptr)));
536 
537  // Create a vector of indices to represent all points in the cloud
538  std::vector<int> indices(cloud->points.size());
539  std::iota(indices.begin(), indices.end(), 0); // Fill with 0, 1, ..., n-1
540 
541  // Shuffle the indices to randomize their order
542  std::random_shuffle(indices.begin(), indices.end());
543 
544  // Iterate through the first 20 randomized indices in the cloud
545  for (int i = 0; i < 20 && i < indices.size(); ++i)
546  {
547  auto& point = cloud->points[indices[i]];
548  // Iterate through colours with defined r,g,b values
549  for (const auto &colour_pair : basket_colour_)
550  {
551  // check whether it is the same for point' rgb value and defined rgb value for each colour
552  if (isColourMatch(point, colour_pair.second))
553  {
554  colour_counts[colour_pair.first]++;
555  break; // Found a matching colour, no need to check the rest
556  }
557  }
558  }
559 
560  // Use the majority colour as the colour of the cluster
561  std::string colour_maj = "";
562  int max_count = 0;
563  for (const auto &colour_count : colour_counts)
564  {
565  if (colour_count.second > max_count)
566  {
567  max_count = colour_count.second;
568  colour_maj = colour_count.first;
569  }
570  }
571  return colour_maj; // Return the most frequent colour
572 }
573 
574 
576 
577 bool
578 PclProcessor::isColourMatch(const PointT &point, const std::vector<double> &expected_colour, double tol)
579 {
580  // Normorlize the RGB value of a extracted point
581  r = static_cast<double>(point.r) / 255.0;
582  g = static_cast<double>(point.g) / 255.0;
583  b = static_cast<double>(point.b) / 255.0;
584 
585  // Get rgb values of the expected colour
586  expected_r = expected_colour[0];
587  expected_g = expected_colour[1];
588  expected_b = expected_colour[2];
589 
590  // Return true if the differences between detected rgb values and expected ones are within the tolerance
591  return (std::abs(r - expected_r) <= tol &&
592  std::abs(g - expected_g) <= tol &&
593  std::abs(b - expected_b) <= tol);
594 }
595 
596 void
597 PclProcessor::differentiateCluster(std::map<int, clusterProperties> &pcProperties)
598 {
599  // Separate clusters into baskets and cubes based on sizeThreshold
600  for (auto &item : pcProperties)
601  {
602  if (item.second.type == "basket")
603  baskets.insert(item);
604  else if (item.second.type == "cube")
605  {
606  item.second.position.z = 0.02;
607  cubes.insert(item);
608  }
609  }
610 }
PointT
pcl::PointXYZRGBA PointT
